text.text: How do I initiate the process of posting multiple patient transactions?

text: To initiate the process of posting multiple patient transactions, you can click "Create a transaction" on the navigation bar. This will take you to the Line-item Editor page or the New Transaction page.

text.text: Can I specify a different transaction number for each claim when posting multiple patient transactions?

text: Yes, when you are posting multiple patient transactions, you can specify a different transaction number for each claim at the line-item level. This gives you the ability to group patient payments in one transaction and then specify the transaction number at the claim level when adding the payment details.

text.text: What options do I have to select from when entering the transaction type?

text: When entering the transaction type, you can select a type from the list.

text.text: How do I enter the deposit date for the transactions?

text: To enter the deposit date, you can select a date of the deposit from the calendar or manually type it in.

text.text: Is it possible to manually enter the transaction amount for each patient transaction?

text: Yes, you can manually enter the transaction amount for each patient transaction.

text.text: What steps should I follow to add a line item for the next transaction after entering the first one?

text: To add a line item for the next transaction, you can click the Add a line item button.

text.text: How can I ensure that the unallocated amount reads 0.00 before posting the transactions?

text: The unallocated amount should read 0.00 before posting the transactions. If it is not zero, you must reconcile the difference.

text.text: Where can I view the transactions I've just posted?

text: You can view the transactions you've just posted by clicking Payments and then the date you made the deposit. There could be a lot transactions for this date so filter the page. You can find transactions you made by entering your name in the box under "Created by".

text.text: How can I filter the transactions to find a specific one I'm looking for?

text: You can filter the transactions to find a specific one by entering your name in the box under "Created by".

text.text: What actions can I perform from the window displaying the posted line items of a transaction?

text: From the window displaying the posted line items of a transaction, you can delete an individual transaction, reverse the entire transaction, or edit the transaction.

text.text: Is it possible to delete individual transactions from the list of posted transactions?

text: Yes, you can delete individual transactions from the list of posted transactions. To do this, you need to click the transaction amount, which will display a list of the posted line items. From this window, you can delete an individual transaction, reverse the entire transaction, or edit the transaction.

text.text: Can I reverse an entire transaction if needed?

text: Yes, you can reverse an entire transaction. To do this, you need to click the transaction amount, which will display a list of the posted line items. From this window, you can delete an individual transaction, reverse the entire transaction, or edit the transaction.

text.text: What should I do if I need to edit a transaction after it has been posted?

text: You cannot edit a transaction after it has been posted. However, you can edit a transaction before it is posted.

text.text: Are there any limitations or restrictions when entering transaction numbers for each claim?

text: When you are posting multiple patient transactions, you can specify a different transaction number for each claim at the line-item level. This gives you the ability to group patient payments in one transaction and then specify the transaction number at the claim level when adding the payment details.

text.text: How can I ensure accuracy when posting multiple patient transactions?

text: When populated, the "Amount collected" field shows the amount entered in the "Transaction amount" plus any amount that you enter in the Collections fee field. You can also click the transaction amount to display a list of the posted line items.

text.text: How to post multiple payment transaction?

text: To post multiple payment transactions, you can click the Add a line item button. When you are entering amounts in the highlighted fields shown below, you are entering the amount collected for that patient's account and fee associated with that patient's payment.

text.text: How to post the transaction I have posted?

text: Once the unallocated amount reads zero, you can click Post transaction.

To reverse a transaction, you can click Payments on the navigation bar, scroll down the list and click the deposit date, click the transaction amount, and click Reverse transaction. The reversal will show in the credit block. The payment will be reversed in the accounting period.
